verses.verse: Now it came <WH1961> about after <WH310> these <WH428> things <WH1697> that Joseph <WH3130> was told, <WH559> "Behold, <WH2009> your father is sick. <WH1>" So he took <WH2470> his two <WH3947> sons <WH8147> Manasseh <WH1121> and Ephraim <WH4519> with him.

When it was told <WH5046> to Jacob, <WH3290> "Behold, <WH2009> your son <WH1121> Joseph <WH3130> has come <WH935> to you," Israel <WH3478> collected <WH2388> his strength <WH2388> and sat <WH3427> up in the bed. <WH4296>
Then Jacob <WH3290> said <WH559> to Joseph, <WH3130> "God <WH410> Almighty <WH7706> appeared <WH7200> to me at Luz <WH3870> in the land <WH776> of Canaan <WH3667> and blessed <WH1288> me,

and He said <WH559> to me, 'Behold, <WH2009> I will make <WH6509> you fruitful <WH6509> and numerous, <WH7235> and I will make <WH5414> you a company <WH6951> of peoples, <WH5971> and will give <WH5414> this <WH2088> land <WH776> to your descendants <WH2233> after <WH310> you for an everlasting <WH5769> possession. <WH272>'

"And now <WH6258> your two <WH8147> sons, <WH1121> who were born <WH3205> to you in the land <WH776> of Egypt <WH4714> before <WH5704> I came <WH935> to you in Egypt, <WH4714> are mine; Ephraim <WH669> and Manasseh <WH4519> shall be mine, as Reuben <WH7205> and Simeon <WH8095> are.

"But your offspring <WH4138> that have been born <WH3205> after <WH310> them shall be yours; they shall be called <WH7121> by the names <WH8034> of their brothers <WH251> in their inheritance. <WH5159>

"Now as for me, when I came <WH935> from Paddan, <WH6307> Rachel <WH7354> died, <WH4191> to my sorrow, <WH5921> in the land <WH776> of Canaan <WH3667> on the journey, <WH1870> when there was still <WH5750> some <WH3530> distance <WH3530> <WH776> to go <WH935> to Ephrath; <WH672> and I buried <WH6912> her there <WH8033> on the way <WH1870> to Ephrath <WH672> (that is, Bethlehem <WH1035>)."
When Israel <WH3478> saw <WH7200> Joseph's sons, <WH1121> he said, <WH559> "Who <WH4310> are these <WH428>?"

And Joseph <WH3130> said <WH559> to his father, "They are my sons, <WH1> whom <WH1121> God <WH834> has given <WH430> me here. <WH5414>" So he said, <WH2088> "Bring <WH559> them to me, please, <WH3947> that I may bless <WH4994> them."

Now the eyes <WH5869> of Israel <WH3478> were [so] dim <WH3513> from age <WH2207> [that] he could <WH3201> not see. <WH7200> Then Joseph brought <WH5066> them close <WH5066> to him, and he kissed <WH5401> them and embraced <WH2263> them.

And Israel <WH3478> said <WH559> to Joseph, <WH3130> "I never <WH3808> expected <WH6419> to see <WH7200> your face, <WH6440> and behold, <WH2009> God <WH430> has let me see <WH7200> your children <WH2233> as well. <WH1571>"
Then Joseph <WH3130> took <WH3318> them from his knees, <WH1290> and bowed <WH7812> with his face <WH639> to the ground. <WH776>

And Joseph <WH3130> took <WH3947> them both, <WH8147> Ephraim <WH669> with his right <WH3225> hand <WH3225> toward <WH4480> Israel's left, <WH8040> and Manasseh <WH4519> with his left <WH8040> hand <WH8040> toward <WH4480> Israel's right, <WH3225> and brought <WH5066> them close <WH5066> to him.

But Israel <WH3478> stretched <WH7971> out his right <WH3225> hand <WH3225> and laid <WH7896> it on the head <WH7218> of Ephraim, <WH669> who <WH1931> was the younger, <WH6810> and his left <WH8040> hand <WH8040> on Manasseh <WH4519>'s head, <WH7218> crossing <WH9603> his hands, <WH3027> although <WH3588> Manasseh was the first-born.

And he blessed <WH1288> Joseph, <WH3130> and said, <WH559> "The God <WH430> before <WH6440> whom <WH834> my fathers Abraham <WH1> and Isaac <WH85> walked, <WH3327> The God <WH1980> who has been my shepherd <WH430> all <WH7462> <WH4480> my life <WH5750> to this <WH5750> day, <WH2088>

The angel <WH4397> who has redeemed <WH1350> me from all <WH3605> evil, <WH9563> Bless <WH1288> the lads; <WH5288> And may my name <WH8034> live <WH7121> on in them, And the names <WH8034> of my fathers Abraham <WH1> and Isaac; <WH85> And may they grow <WH3327> into a multitude <WH1711> in the midst <WH7230> of the earth. <WH7130>"

When Joseph <WH3130> saw <WH7200> that his father laid <WH1> his right <WH7896> hand <WH3225> on Ephraim's head, <WH3027> it displeased <WH7218> him; and he grasped <WH7489> his father's hand <WH8551> to remove <WH3027> it from Ephraim's head <WH5493> to Manasseh's head. <WH7218>
And Joseph <WH3130> said <WH559> to his father, "Not so, <WH1> my father, for this <WH3651> one <WH1> is the first-born. Place <WH2088> your right <WH2088> hand <WH7760> on his head. <WH3225>"

But his father refused <WH1> and said, <WH3985> "I know, <WH559> my son, <WH3045> I know; <WH1121> he also <WH3045> shall become <WH1571> a people <WH1961> and he also <WH5971> shall be great. <WH1571> However, <WH1431> his younger <WH199> brother <WH9512> shall be greater <WH251> than <WH1431> he, and his descendants <WH4480> shall become <WH2233> a multitude <WH1961> of nations. <WH4393>"

And he blessed <WH1288> them that day, <WH3117> saying, <WH559> "By you Israel <WH3478> shall pronounce <WH1288> blessing, <WH1288> saying, <WH559> 'May God <WH430> make <WH7760> you like Ephraim <WH669> and Manasseh! <WH4519>'" Thus he put <WH7760> Ephraim <WH669> before <WH6440> Manasseh. <WH4519>

Then Israel <WH3478> said <WH559> to Joseph, <WH3130> "Behold, <WH2009> I am about to die, <WH4191> but God <WH430> will be with you, and bring <WH7725> you back <WH7725> to the land <WH776> of your fathers.

"And I give <WH5414> you one <WH259> portion <WH7926> more <WH5921> than <WH5921> your brothers, <WH251> which <WH834> I took <WH3947> from the hand <WH3027> of the Amorite <WH567> with my sword <WH2719> and my bow. <WH7198>"
